meanings.sent1: The cheetah can outgallop any other animal in the savannah.
meanings.sent2: The racehorse managed to outgallop its competitors and win the race.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, claiming he could outgallop him.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed allowed her to outgallop all obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to outgallop the speeding train as it rushed through the valley.

meanings.sent1: The gazelle tried to outgallop the lion to safety.
meanings.sent2: The wild stallion was able to outgallop the pursuing cowboys.
meanings.sent3: The little rabbit thought it could outgallop the big, clumsy bear.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts would outgallop her actions, leading to hasty decisions.
meanings.sent5: The river's current seemed to outgallop the fish swimming upstream.
